title: NASA to Host Briefings to Preview Artemis I Moon Mission
summary: NASA will host a pair of briefings on Wednesday, Aug. 3, and Friday, Aug. 5, to preview the upcoming Artemis I lunar mission.

title: NASA Announces Astronaut Shane Kimbrough to Retire
summary: NASA’s Shane Kimbrough is retiring after 22 years, including 18 years as an astronaut. His last day with the agency is Sunday, July 31.

title: NASA Marks 25 Years Since Pathfinder Touched Down on Mars
summary: The newly deployed Sojourner rover – the first of its kind on the Red Planet – sits on the Martian surface after driving down Pathfinder’s ramp.

title: Orion teams ready for Artemis 1 as pre-launch preparations head into the home stretch
summary: With the Artemis 1 mission just weeks away from launch, teams at NASA and the program’s contractors are carrying out final preparations for this major milestone in the effort to return humans to the Moon. NASASpaceflight sat down with Mike Hawes, the Vice President and Program Manager for Orion at Lockheed Martin to discuss how the company was preparing its spacecraft for this mission.

title: NASA Will Inspire World When It Returns Mars Samples to Earth in 2033
summary: NASA has finished the system requirements review for its Mars Sample Return Program, which is nearing completion of the conceptual design phase.

title: NASA prepares to award SLS launch services contract to Boeing-Northrop joint venture
summary: NASA is preparing to award a contract to a Boeing-Northrop Grumman joint venture for Space Launch System missions that could run through the middle of the next decade.

title: CAS Space puts six satellites in orbit with first orbital launch
summary: Chinese launch services provider CAS Space successfully placed six small satellites in orbit early Wednesday with the first launch of the Lijian-1 solid rocket.

title: ESA selects Viasat for multi-orbit satellite communications study
summary: Viasat said July 26 it has been selected to study multi-orbit satellite networks for the European Space Agency.

title: Startup Wallaroo Labs wins Space Force contract to model performance of AI on edge devices
summary: Wallaroo Labs won a Phase 1 Small Business Innovation Research study contract from the U.S. Space Force to model the performance of machine learning and artificial intelligence algorithms during space missions.

title: NASA Prepares for Space Launch System Rocket Services Contract
summary: As NASA prepares for the first integrated flight test of the Space Launch System (SLS) rocket and the Orion spacecraft to the Moon this summer as part of Artemis, the agency is moving toward a services contract model for long-term SLS hardware production and operations to reduce costs.
